transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: (Orchestra version of "Hit Single" theme, with snappy new graphics, and following titles
Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (fade in) Greetings! I am Space Ghost! My first guest tonight is the incredible, the incomparable Steve Allen! (pause) Steve Allen? Is that right, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (piano intro plays in background) Yep, that's right. We got Steve Allen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings:)Oh my, I can't believe my ears,I have waited for this moment for years.How can this be?Steve Allen's gonna talk to me?Steve Allen!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Steve Allen?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, Zorak, Steve Allen!Why, he's the greatest talk show host,From Atlantic to Pacific coast,I really do not mean to boast,That we've got Steve Allen.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, I got Steve Allen!I twisted arms, I threatened harm,In galaxies, I caused alarm,Made many agents buy the farm,Just to get you Steve Allen!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He's got you, SG, give him credit,He doesn't just direct and edit,Moltar needs to have some credi-i-i-it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay Moltar, Zorak's right,I do not want to start a fight,But if you cross me I just mightPull Steve Allen!

transcript.speaker: Zorak & Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Steve Allen?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I can't believe we got Steve Allen!

transcript.speaker: All
transcript.dialogue: Steve Allen! (music ends)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, Moltar, how'd you score Steve Allen anyway?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (reading a book) I threatened to give his manager a third degree burn.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bonus!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, play me to the desk. Something.. snappy!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sighs, then sings:)Oh, I am but a mantis,So evil and so mean,Forced into this position,Is it because I'm green?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk, then sings)Oh, I did not imprison youFor the color of your skin.You see, Zorak, I'm colorblind,What's outside doesn't count,True evil's from withi-i-i-i-i-in!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I can see so clearly now,You've taught me quite a lesson.Oh, thank you, thank you, Space Gho-o-o-ost,You truly are a blessin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (spoken) Aw, Zorak, that's sweet.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I'm gonna vomit! (music ends)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thank you! Thank you! Thanks so much! Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor) (hums and bops) I was just talkin' to some of my friends on the street. (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh. Uh, hey, hey there.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Is that Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yes, it is I, Space Ghost. (snickers) It, it's an honor to have you on the show. (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (snickers) Steve. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: I'm very honored to, uh, permit you to be honored by talking to me, Spacey. There, Ghostie, whoever you are. (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Yeah, yeah. Do that noise with your armpits!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (puts his hand in his armpit and flaps his arm, making bird noises with his mouth. As he does so, digits are added to the SAT number on the monitor until it says:)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Is that what you mean?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what's the holdup? What are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (music begins, sings:)"Moltar, what are you doing?"It's a question I've heard all my life.My parents don't understand me,And neither does my wife.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: She's a sweet and simple girl, my Linda.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar? Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: A lovely lava lass, you see...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Send out the guest! (music stops abruptly)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Alright, alright! (throws lever, quick cuts of the following images: a test pattern from Brussles, an image of a satelite, a disclaimer of some sort from a news show, a test pattern from CNN London, as the images flash by, the number increases to 3.141592653; sends Steve to the studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (as monitor lowers from ceiling with Steve) Ladies and gentlemen, you've seen him, ya know him, ya love him, you go through a phase where you don't love him so much, yet you don't want to hurt him, so you don't dare tell him of your feelings, so you marry him, you bear his children, and you live out the rest of your days suffering from his cold and silent indifference, say hello to Steve Allen!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The pleasure's mine, Steverino. Have you met my arch-enemy Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? No, but I would be honored to meet any fellow musician. What does he play, by the way?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's our mantis king of the keyboards!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Ah, good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Steve. Mind if I snack on your head?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who-a-a-a-a! Hey, Steve, ya hear that?

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, it makes me laugh, as you just saw, I found it amusing that someone would want to snack on my head. There's an old song, "Snack on my head", no, no, I'm sorry, that's "Time on my hands"...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no no no no no no no, that's right, Steve. Show him, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (music starts, sings:)There are heads just right for some snackin',And I mean to snack on a few.Come on, Steve, it's time to get crackin',I got a lot o' snackin' to do!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, there are villains just right for some whackin',And I mean to whack me a few.Come on, Zorak, it's about to happen,I got a lot o' whackin' to do!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: There are fires just right for some settin',And I aim to set a few fires.When those fires get set they'll be burnin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We hate you!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And.. um, er... (music ends abruptly)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're dumb!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But... I was just... (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No! You're stupid! So just shut up, stupid!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: ... tryin' to...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: ... fit in.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stupid!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ugh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what do you think of my show, Steve?

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's the first of its kind, and, and so you're just as good as I am, I did the first of my kind, you've done the first of your kind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (music starts, sings:)Then let the record so reflect,'Twas I that got there first.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Alright, then let the record so reflect.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Even thought I never getThe credit I deserve.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: You raise a very sore point.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Lah di dah di dah di dah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You forgot the words, you jerk!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: How you like that for a snappy comeback?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come and get it!Come and get it!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You're really really really gonna get it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You'll regret itWhen you get it,Because it isn't something that you want.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What are you talking about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Zorak,I'm sick of your beak.I'm gonna blast youInto next week.(aims his powerband and blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) (coughs, then sings:)Oh, I get it,Now, this pain is very dear to me.You see, when I get blasted,It makes your intentions clear to me-e-e-e-e.(coughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sittin' in the control room,Waitin' for the break,Waitin' for the bre-a-a-ak,Waitin' for the break to co-o-o-o-ome.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (music starts, sings:)Sittin' in the control room,Waitin' for the break,Waitin' for the bre-a-a-ak,Waitin' for the break to en-n-n-n-n-n-nd!. (music ends)Uh, isn't anyone gonna tell me to shut up?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You don't deserve it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, and we're setting up the next bit, so shut up, stupid! (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You just told him to shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I did?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes, you did!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah well... Now it's time for Steve Allen to do a little bit of his "Man on the Street" schtick.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Yes, of course, I need a street, and I need at least one man. You have a sample man for me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Only the samplest. Brak? (music begins)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Brak, can you hear me?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (appearing in many different background scenes, sings:)On the street,On the street,I think there's something stuck on my feet!Life is great,I feel grand,I could eat a whole pound o' ham!Hello, Mr. Sidewalk,How'd you get so long?Do you mind bein' under meAs I sing this happy song?On the street,On the street,Whe-e-ere I a-a-am, I'm on-n-n the-e-e stre-e-e-e-e-eet!On the street!

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, I guess that constitutes a yes. Brak!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (says something in Brakese), eh?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy! (laughs) Ah, boy, I get it! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: You got it, good, well, go tell your mother.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I won't.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, do you know Brak's language?

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Are you surprised to learn that I actually speak Brakese?

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Hit me again, Steverino.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (says something else in Brakese)

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's what she said! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I'm hip, but it was supposed to be just between you and me.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: You're funny, Steve Allen.

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Brak, and, and Spacie and Ghostie, and all the dwarfs who are out there today around the old campfire.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Steve Allen. And from all of us here around the old campfire...

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (music starts, sings:)It's.. been.. great!It's been fun!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But your interview is done.So get out of the chair,And get out of my hair!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause it's almost like bein' inLo-o-o-o-o-ove! (music ends)

transcript.speaker: Audience
transcript.dialogue: (applause)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (with Andy Dick on control room monitor, which now shows SAT 3.14159265358; throws lever, creating a burst of feedback) Whoa, did you hear that? (digits are added until the next song begins, at which point it is up to SAT 3.141592653589793

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I heard it really loud.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I hit the wrong switch.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Oh, man.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna do it again. (throws lever, creating another burst of feedback)

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: (yells)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what's going on in there?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, Andy Dick, comin' right up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (music starts) Andy Dick? Is that right, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yep, that's right. We got Andy Dick.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings:)Oh my! I can't believe my ears!I've waited for this moment for years!How can this be?Andy Dick's gonna talk to me?Andy Dick!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Andy Dick? Why did we get Andy Dick?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Because Linda loves Andy Di-i-i-i-ick.And as you know,She's a sweet and simple girl, my Linda,A lovely lava lass, you see. (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (music stops abruptly) Shut up! Stupid!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We hate you!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait a minute. Steve Allen... Andy Dick... they both have first names for last names! It's a "theme" show! Good work, stupid! (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah, well, sure. That's.. what I had in mind.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: (breathes on glasses) Oh, Space Ghost. Hello!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Andy, did you like our little Andy Dick song?

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: That is sweet, that is sweet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's a reprise of the song, "I Can't Believe We Got Steve Allen."

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Oh, so it's not, uh... (takes a deep breath) it's not that special.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No no no, it's very special!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but you wrote it for Steve Allen, and then you just inserted my, no, it's fine, though, it's fine, I, I...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyway, Steve Allen ate up a lot of time, so I don't reallly have a lot of...

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: You don't have any!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, we don't have a ton of...

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: You. Don't. Have. Any.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (holding his blast rifle) Woo hoo! (cocks rifle) Looks like a feudin's on the way!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (music starts, sings:)Down in the holler,Amongst the filth and squalor,Looks like a feud there's gonna be.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The number's been cut! (music stops abruptly) Look, Red, I don't really have a lot of time to be confrontational about this, so...

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: You're right, I don't want to, either, actually, because I don't have superpowers.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Andy, you wouldn't stand a chance against my destructo ray or my heat ray or my freeze ray or my...

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: I know what you have. I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aiming at Andy) Andy...

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's better.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: I have an inviso belt, that I can, I can turn invisible. (looks down at his belt) Oh, I'm not wearing it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hoo, you're not wearing it? Well, maybe it's at home in the magic closet!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know, thinking about it, you don't have an inviso belt. (angry) Because only my colleagues and I wear them!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Okay, um, you're right, I don't... I don't have one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alright, now tell everyone at home!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no, no, no, no, no!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do it!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: I don't have an inviso belt. (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Andy, sing your song.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I have to sing it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Will you sing it with me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sing! Sing like Judy Collins!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: (guitar accompaniment, sings:)Space Ghost, Space Ghost, put down that stick.Please don't beat up Andy Dick.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (orchestra accompaniment, sings:)Andy, Andy, you're getting me ticked!Think I'm pummel Andy Dick!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, Space Ghost, clickety click,Space Ghost, don't be a space -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Andy, Andy, clickety click,Andy, don't be a -

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, don't be a -

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Andy, don't be a space -

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: (together with Space Ghost's last line, so the guitar and orchestra are also together) Space Ghost don't be a -

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, everybody, it's time for the big finale! (Moltar's monitor says:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's time for the finale,

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's time to end the show.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The fun we've had is over now,

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, it's time to go.

transcript.speaker: Lokar
transcript.dialogue: I didn't have any lines today,

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That made some people glad!

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: (dances into view) I'm really very sad!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's all the time we have today,We finally get a chance,To see while Moltar rolls the credits,Andy Dick will dance.Goodbye!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Goodbye!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye!Good night, everybody!(to Andy) Now, dance!

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: A five, six, seven, eight... (tap dances to schmaltzy piano music while the credits roll) How much do you want, I can go on all day.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do it all day.

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I can do anything, I can shuffle off to Buffalo.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, why don't you shuffle off to Mars?

transcript.speaker: Andy Dick
transcript.dialogue: I can't, I can't shuffle off too far, though.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Wuss. (piano ends)

transcript.speaker: Steve Allen
transcript.dialogue: (hums and bops)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This has been a Ghost Planet Industries production. Oh! (raspberry sound) That's what I did in rehearsal, and everybody laughed. (sings:) Oh, my! I can't believe my ears!
